subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0072_01C9D560.850713A0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I always listen to EVP's with high quality headphones.

In the "tomorrow le=
t you know" EVP, I do hear something....just can't be sure that it is a voi=
ce. I does have a cadence similar to someone speaking, but it could just as=
 easily be something present in the environment-a natural background noise.=
 There is no way for me to tell for certain as it is just too feint. I can'=
t make out any clear words. Sure-I could probably matrix some in, but that =
is all it would be.

For an EVP to be considered proof positive of spirit c=
ommunication by the community at large, it has to be clear enough that many=
 people hear the same thing, without hints or coaxing. If you have to have =
high quality devices to make it out, it just isn't good enough. That does n=
ot mean it isn't a true EVP, just that it isn't good enough to stand as evi=
dence.

As for the whistle, it sounded like feedback to me as well, but I w=
ill have to take you word for it that you were no where near any other elec=
tronics or EMF's that could contribute to feedback. Even so, if I am trying=
 to remain unbiased and objective, there is no way for me to say this is a =
spirit, without personally being with you when you caught it. The only thin=
g I can still say about it is could be, but for me it is non conclusive.

I=
f someone does not hear what you are hearing, try to remain objective and j=
ust understand that it isn't personal. You have to understand that with jus=
t these recordings alone, there is no way to scientifically prove what you =
have recorded is spirit communication. If you could get consistent, intelli=
gent question and answer recordings, then you would be alot closer.

Here a=
gain, we are back to the "So what?" thing. You don't HAVE to prove anything=
 scientifically, unless you want others to completely believe in your evide=
nce.

The theory that is being kicked around is that some EVP's are persona=
l, and only meant for the person recording them to hear. If this is the cas=
e, no matter how clear something is to you, others may not hear it.

April
=


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: James W. Hyslope 
  To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 12:02 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] =
Re: what you hear is what you get





  Okay, I can respect that. If you c=
an't hear them then it must be either mechanical (sound card or headphones)=
or maybe your hearing has loss in those frequencies....Some of these are no=
t very clear or loud enough too. But many will depend on your computer soun=
d card & your headphones. I have let an older man listen (in his late 60's)=
 and he has heard most all of the audio. Same with a few guys at work. Some=
 hear them right away, and others can't until I loop the actually EVP for a=
 few tries. I personally use a Dell Latitude D430 to hear these. I can hear=
 some on my cell phone. Headphones are a must....or you won't hear anything=
 either way. *But some can be heard on cell phone without headphones. The c=
onversion to MP3 has also caused some loss, but I am still able to hear the=
m when I review from this site (but I have the repetive hearing syndrome in=
 this area no doubt). Although I do have some disbelief (shock) that a few =
of these are not discernable. Go back and listen to "tomorrow let you know"=
 is in a gruffy-robotic melodic tone at the very end but with higher natura=
l volume. And if you couldn't hear the whistle...I would suggest the need t=
o remove the cotton from the ear :) As for feedback.....feedback from what?=
 I only had one recorder working here. I would rather hear someone say "I" =
made the whistle....that would be more understandable. And is very true....=
if someone "tells" the group that THIS is supposed to be what WAS said, the=
n is very difficult to clear the mind to hear it any other way. Kinda like =
trying to hum another song while a different one is playing :) --- In EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
  >
  > Here's t=
he thing though - if you put something out there, and ask people to listen =
to it, your inviting opinions. Some will be in agreement, and some won't, n=
o matter what.
  > 
  > If EVP messages are for the one that recorded them,=
 then it shouldn't surprise you, or offend you, if someone doesn't hear the=
 same thing you do. If you don't want contrary opinions on something, then =
you should not give people the chance to critique.
  > 
  > Now I could see=
 if someone flat out said your recordings were all trash, period. You would=
 have every right to be angry, but no one is saying that, at least I am not=
 saying that.
  > 
  > I just stated that I did not hear what James heard, =
and though I wasn't going to say he doesn't have anything, I can't say that=
 he does either.
  > 
  > ----- Original Message ----- 
  > From: Frank Sum=
ption 
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 11:0=
0 AM
  > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
  > 
  > =

  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > Yeah, and we've all heard the thing about opinions=
.
  > 
  > F-s
  > 
  > 
  > On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:53 AM, April Abercr=
ombie <april@...> wrote:
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > Noone is saying what =
they hear is law, just their opinion.
  > 
  > ----- Original Message -----=
 
  > From: Frank Sumption 
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Frid=
ay, May 15, 2009 10:43 AM
  > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is w=
hat you get
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > Soooo, everyone hears different, and persona=
lly I find it offensive when someone presumes to tell everyone what another=
 researhcer's voices really say. I think EVP messages are for the one that =
recorded thmm, to everyone else it's non-sense, except there's enough to sh=
ow that there is a phenomenon. 
  > 
  > I get really tired of these self p=
roclaimed experts trying to dicate what's acceptable.
  > 
  > Frank-S
  > =

  > 
  > On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:04 AM, Rick <rasterer@...> wrote:
  > =

  > 
  > 
  > 
  > I opened your folder and examined all your files.
  > 
=
  > Here are my opinions (I have truncated the file names due to laziness):=

  > 
  > ahh_mmm noises, no speech
  > call_us noises, no speech
  > cal_u=
s (enhanced) several listenings: pixelated, no speech
  > compare_panasonic=
 noises, no speech
  > compare_sony noises, no speech
  > first_epv noises,=
 no speech
  > good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe feedback)
  > hey_can =
noises, no speech
  > hey_whats noises, no speech
  > I_hit noises, no spee=
ch
  > important_date noises, no speech
  > keep_moving several listenings:=
 Hellalal see woobeh 
  > laugh_evp noises, no speech
  > lets_wait several=
 listenings: noises, no speech
  > maybe_gun noises, no speech
  > miss_you=
 noises, no speech
  > my_question several listenings: no da lee
  > oh_ no=
ises, no speech
  > something several listenings: noises, no speech
  > tha=
t_mans noises, no speech
  > that's_jim noises, no speech
  > this_one seve=
ral listenings: noises, no speech
  > tomorrow noises, no speech
  > 
  > T=
he ones that took several listenings I thought I might hear words in, so I =
examined those several times. Sometimes I could sort of hear something that=
 sort of sounded like what you suggested, but I could also hear it in other=
 ways, or not at all.
  > 
  > So my suggestion to you, if you want to get =
less subjective conjuctures or simply less affirmations of your own interpr=
etations, is to post the future ones without labels. The labels you give ca=
n influence the listeners: when you have a sound that could be several thin=
gs, and you note that it sounded like "keep it moving", the listener can fi=
nd it nearly impossible to try NOT to hear what you heard, and so not be ab=
le to give a fresh perspecive to help your research methods. 
  > 
  > 
  >=
 
  > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "James W. Hyslope" <clockdryve@> wrot=
e:
  > >
  > > Go to my Folder in the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" a=
nd see if anyone (needs to) decide "FOR ME" and let me know if I am of the =
serious type. In my short time I have gathered enough "proof" for myself th=
at this method works for ME. And from what I have seen from others that I h=
ave let "listen" to my files (friends) I am blessed with the "ability" to H=
EAR very low audio artifacts....so this will help me in my RESEARCH. And I =
am OPEN to any help to reach my goals (or help others) with their goals. Ha=
ve fun people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I was lucky enough to catch the RR-DR60=
 taking a nap yesterday....it missed a few evp's real close together (in a =
5 second clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a male use a different number than wha=
t I used. I said 16 (my earlier age I was saying in recorder) and the male =
evp said 13....then a female laughs. All this was missed by the DR60 (excep=
t my 16 was recorded in both recorders) BUT then the DR60 "caught" the B7 "=
napping" at near the end of the 5 second clip....the DR60 heard "let me out=
" in a clear (quite) males voice. So this is very promising piece of eviden=
ce for me. **those 2 recordings have been uploaded to my folder. I will inc=
lude an Olympus W-10 (soon as arrives), Panasonic RR-US360 (when I think to=
 grab it) and my RR-QR80 to go with my RR-QR100, and one more (can't rememb=
er what brand-model of this last---due to arrive) LOL. I need to build a mu=
ltiple mounting devise to aid in putting these into tandem service. Then I =
think I will use my Olympus DS-50 as my "Control" recorder....by using it o=
n the HQ settings. I am looking to build a "subsonic" microphone also (some=
thing to do with those low "booms" that I have noticed lead or follow many =
evp's). So I look forward to any ideas. Falure is NOT an option. Haha.....
=
  > >
  >
